column4: if you want that module to load on boot, add it to /etc/modules
not sure how to do that
yeah, I am just using pico, does that make a dif?
no, gksudo gedit works as well, and add the module name to an empty line
what was the module you wanted to be loaded on boot again?
no, it was some ethernet device you wanted to work
yeah.... I am not sure, I just know that that is the file I am supposed to edit, but it is not present...
forget all about /etc/rc.d/rc.modules, it does not exist in ubuntu
ok... so I don't need to add a module?
8139too <-- put that on a blank line in /etc/modules
alright. so whats it going to do again?
every time you boot up, the modules in /etc/modules are modprobed
functionally the same result as the slackware howto you were using
